que le diable soit de ton dieu

Great disputes with Mengeotte's husband over some hay he had taken from them
Had refused to 'mener des voiles' with her husband
After quarrel between her husband and Demenge Saffrois she called them 'cocquins'. Witness called her witch and threatened to have her burned

notable_quotes.speaker: Mongeatte femme Thoussainct de Leuce
notable_quotes.french: que sy elle estoit prinse pour une sorciere, que luy seroit prins pour ung meurtrier
notable_quotes.context: Said during quarrel with husband, as reported by former servant Didier Maillé

notable_quotes.speaker: Chretien Brandecq (quoting Mongeatte)
notable_quotes.french: voila une belle vache, dieu la veulle garder
notable_quotes.context: Said when witness was taking cow to drink; cow died within hours

notable_quotes.speaker: Colas Brabant (quoting Mongeatte)
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle se donne de garde qu'il n'en advient quelque chose, et qu'il y prendroit soigneuse garde, laquelle feit response qu'il n'en ait doubté, mais que par la mere dieu qu'il montreroit ces propos là, et qu'elle en donneroit advertissement a son marit et qu'il les mangeroit
notable_quotes.context: Exchange when his oxen escaped into her meadow

notable_quotes.speaker: Mongeatte femme Thoussainct de Leuce
notable_quotes.french: et comme de propos fortes rudes et farouches dit que par la mort dieu ce n'estoit encor faict
notable_quotes.context: Interrupted conversation between witness and maire about sick husband

notable_quotes.speaker: husband of Mongeatte (as reported by Catherine femme Claudon Mathieu)
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle prevenue estoit une malheureuse, et qu'elle ne valoit rien que de mettre des pauvres au monde
notable_quotes.context: Heard during quarrel between husband and wife

notable_quotes.speaker: Mongeatte femme Thoussainct de Leuce
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle n'en est point cause, et qu'elle void bien que tous ceulx qui ont mal diront que c'est faict de sorcerie et que dieu n'envoyeroit point a faire ainsy
notable_quotes.context: During interrogation about illness of Jennon femme Colas Blasat

notable_quotes.speaker: Mongeatte femme Thoussainct de Leuce
notable_quotes.french: qu'il ne fault plus faire de bien au monde, qu'elle a donné plusieurs fois de la viande a laur porcqz craindant de ne la donner aux pauvres, a cause qu'on y poulroit penser de mal s'il arrivoit quelque chose

notable_quotes.speaker: Mongeatte femme Thoussainct de Leuce
notable_quotes.french: qu'il faudroit bien vivre sy on ne vouloit avoir disputes avec quelques personnes, mais pour tout cela elle ne porte aucune hayne
notable_quotes.context: When court reproached her for denying disputes then admitting them

notable_quotes.speaker: la Faillée (as reported)
notable_quotes.french: que ladite prevenue a cause de ses richesses eschapperoit, mais qu'elle estoit plus pire qu'elle pour cedit crime
notable_quotes.context: Said when being taken to execution 18 years earlier

material_culture.context: Ongoing lawsuit over goats between husband of accused and Demenge Jean du Paire
Daughter of Colas Charier caught taking young beans from accused's garden
Demenge Jean Mercier knocked off her coiffe when she went to see him during his illness
Henry Claude forbade family to buy wine she was selling
Obtained from house of accused for cure of Bastien Fourney
She sent a glass of honey to Bastien Fourney unasked
Jennon femme Colas Blasat sent her some milk
Didier Mazellay spent 50 écus in vain search for cure for his wife
More than 100 écus spent in vain search for cure for Demenge Jean Mercier
Claudon Estienne took knives to her daughter Sabel
Gave master a chicken each year to be exempted from going to sabbat more often
Given by devil: black to kill, yellow to make languish, white to cure
Devil gave her money which turned out to be leaves
Husband struck her in back with a stick when he returned from Thiaville
Great disputes with husband of Mengeotte over hay he had taken

Didier Villemin and wife 'much worse off' after losing animals

hearsay_chains.content: heard from Didier Maillé that when she and husband were quarrelling she said 'que sy elle estoit prinse pour une sorciere, que luy seroit prins pour ung meurtrier'
heard late Jean Mathieu claim she had killed his wife Dedie after quarrel
heard Demenge Charton of Moyenmoûtier call her witch
Father had always maintained that she had bewitched him during fatal illness
servant who was ill went to devin and reported that accused with others were cause of their fortunes
When la Faillée was being taken to execution she said accused would escape because of riches but was worse than her for the crime

emotional_state_notes: Said she was a good woman and had always had fear of shaming her parents

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Demenge Jean du Paire had allowed himself to be called thief
Jennon femme Colas Blasat had had intercourse with Nicolas Menusier and one from Allemaigne before her marriage
Catherine femme Claudon Mathieu was a thief
Didier Villemin had long been accustomed to defame people

third_parties.context: Father of 6-month-old daughter who died while being nursed by Catherine veuve Henry Claude

third_parties.name: Demenge Jean Mercier

extraction_metadata.notes: Trial w223 of Mongeatte femme Thoussainct de Leuce from la Neuveville-les-Raon. Extensive witness testimony (43 witnesses) documenting long reputation (18-22 years). Economic context significant: accused described as poor, husband's harsh words about bringing poor children into world. Pattern of harms following quarrels, particularly related to husband's occupation 'mener des voiles' (taking rafts of logs on river). Confessed under torture to seduction 20 years earlier, receiving three types of powder, attending sabbat 3 times yearly. Named only already-executed or deceased accomplices. Approved for torture and execution by Change de Nancy. Economic disputes prominent throughout testimony.
